actions: She's here. Did I kill my mother? What? The bees killed Thomas J. And I killed my mother. No, no. Now, sweetie, that wasn't your fault. Things like that aren't anybody's fault. She came home and painted this whole room pink. She was so sure she would have a little girl. Do you miss her? Yes. I did, very much, for a long time. And even now I get a little sad when I think about a pretty flower or a beautiful sunset that your mother would have liked. I think every time I see or climb a tree I'll think of Thomas J. That's good. Memories are good, sweetheart. Vada, I'm... I'm sorry. I was trying to keep it from you. I just couldn't. You're a good girl. I want you to be happy. Don't be an old grump like me.
